content.question: <math alttext="the integral from 0 to the fraction pi over 2, of, the sine of the fraction x over 2, d x equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msubsup><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>π</mi></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn></mstyle></mfrac></mstyle></msubsup><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of 2, end root, minus 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 minus the sqaure root of 2, and denominator 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 minus the sqaure root of 2, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>
<math alttext="2 minus the square root of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

topic.text: 6.7: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Definite Integrals
